page.title: 06TRANSPORT IN CHIPPERFIELD
page.content: Four "C" class roads take a high volume of through traffic, private & commercial. Speed limits are difficult to enforce especially at morning and evening peak periods. Week-ends and harvest-time also present problems. Other roads are mainly cul-de-sacs serving residential areas. Access to the village may improve with building of a roundabout on the proposed Kings Langley by-pass,(due 1986) but at cost of increased traffic & urbanisation. 2 infrequent bus services link village with Hemel Hempstead, Kings Langley, Watford, Croxley and Rickmansworth. Timings aim to serve local workers, schoolchildren and less effectively shoppers.There are no Sunday services. Most households find life restricted by the public transport system and so own cars to meet the requirements of work, school, shopping and leisure.
